content:

I'm using the following which works ok for week, multi-week and month even when I expand window to maximise. It will be similar to what you see on a 'day' setting, but that depends upon the width of window. For the window size I use, it never appears even in day setting. It depends upon the min-width - I've got 1000px. 


/* CALENDAR  - set event colour instead of calendar colour */  .calendar-category-box{     margin:0 0 0 -200px !important;     min-width: 1000px !important;     }     .alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{     margin:0 0 0 0!important;     }     .event-name-label,.item-time-label,.alarm-icons-box,.reminder-icon{     z-index:100000!important;     }      .calendar-item-flex{     padding:0!important;     }      .calendar-month-day-box-list-item{     margin:0!important;     }      .calendar-color-box{     border:none!important;     }       .event-name-label{     white-space:break-spaces !important;     }

content: if the accounts are Gmail or Outlook, those save to the Sent folder by default. That is, from my experience, even if you set thunderbird to save the sent message elsewhere, a copy still goes to the Sent folder.
creator: davidsk

content:
david is quite correct. Many servers now auto save sent mail in the server 'Sent Mail' folder.

As a heads up: If you right click on an email and select ' Open' > 'Open message in Conversation' It will open in a new tab and contain all messages within that thread including any responses you made even if they have stored in the 'Sent' folder. So you can see the entire conversation in context.

It means you do not have to save sent emails in the Inbox in order to see the conversation in context. It also means the Inbox mbox file does not become so large. After all, the mbox file is just a single text file with emails appended to it as an when they get downloaded. You significantly increase the risk of potential major loss etc if you keep a lot of emails in just a single text file.

The 'Open message in conversation' applies to any email no matter what folder it's stored in.

This is a rather a good way of viewing a particular conversation as it removes all the clutter of other threads and you can leave it open in case you need to go back and refer to it.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Se non spieghi esattamente che problema incontri, non ti si può rispondere... Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: The instructions to reset primary password are different, depending on your release of Thunderbird. This URL has the specifics: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_reset-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk

content:
Please be more specific in what you did. I presume you have thunderbird and profile on old computer, and you're setting up a new computer? If that is the situation, here are my suggested steps:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: A simple way is to locate profiles.ini at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird and edit it to have name you want. That is where thunderbird looks to know what profile to use. Another way is to start thunderbird, click tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation, and at next screen, click to import profile.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, check that you installed from thunderbird.net, and not from Microsoft. The executable should be in c:\program files . Assuming you installed from thunderbird.net, you can locate the active profile this way: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - there you are. note the folder location and folder name. You are in Windows File Explorer inside the profile. - at this point, exit thunderbird - back up one folder so that you are in the Profiles folder. One of the folders in that folder is your copied profile. Since you know the name of the copied profile, you can proceed with some simple file copies. Here are steps: - click to the imported profile - for local folders, open the Mail folder and then the Local Folders folder. All the foldes will appear as foldername, foldername.msf. Ignore the msf entries as those are indexes that will be automatically recreated. Copy the files to the active profile into the same location - Mail\Local Folders - copying POP accounts are a bit more involved, so I'll wait to hear whether you have any.

IF you did NOT find thunderbird.exe in a folder in c:\program files, then we need to start there. Let me know
creator: davidsk

content:
È un problema che di solito si presenta solo con la PEC. In sostanza ti basta andare in rubrica, trovare il contatto che appare sempre come mittente, segnarti i suoi dati per sicurezza e poi eliminarlo.

La spiegazione dettagliata è questa

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremi quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Mittente+sbagliato+nelle+PEC.-
creator: @next
